intro: Kosaria cuspidata, commonly known as the pointed kosaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with pointed tips. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Kosaria cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
